subject: Re: [junit] JUnit and Spring framework
msgSnippet: ... I understand, but some teams need to walk before they run, so I usually try to give walking advice before I give running advice. -- J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger
messageBody:
Vamsee Kanakala wrote:
>
> J. B. Rainsberger wrote:
>
> >Ignore everything except the stored procedures. To test those, you can
> >use something like DbUnit and call the stored procedures from JDBC.
> >
> I've tried DBUnit, but I found that it's valuable only when I have huge
> datasets to be compared, inserted etc. Most of the time, I use easyMock
> for mocking the database access layer, and test it separately with plain
> database set/get methods.

I understand, but some teams need to walk before they run, so I usually
try to give walking advice before I give running advice.
--
J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger
Diaspar Software Services
http://www.diasparsoftware.com
Author, JUnit Recipes: Practical Methods for Programmer Testing
